resources.string: Current Red player is the winner! Congratulations Red!

"Bachet game is named after a french mathematician, poet and translator - Claude Gaspard Bachet de Méziriac (1581 - 1638). This game is played mainly by two players. A player looses when on his turn the score becomes 0."

Dudeney game is named after an english mathematician - Henry Dudeney (1857 – 1930). The game is played mainly by two players. A player looses when on his turn the score becomes more than 37. And a player wins when on his turn the score becomes exactly 37.
